Metadata.Title: 1695 Baptist Catechism
AlternativeTitles: Brief Instruction in the Principles of Christian Religion
Metadata.OriginStory: 'Having a desire to shew our near Agreement with many other Christians, of whom we have great Esteem; we some Years since put forth a Confession of our Faith, almost in all Points the same with that of the Assembly, and Savoy, which was subscribed by the Elders and Messengers of many churches baptized on profession of their Faith; and do now put forth a short Account of Christian Principles, for the Instruction of our Families, in most things agreeing with the Shorter Catechism of the Assembly. And this we were the rather induced to, because we have commonly made use of that Catechism in our Families: And the Difference being not much, it will be more easily committed to Memory.'

Data.Question: Who is the First and Chiefest Being?
Data.Answer: God is the First and Chiefest Being
Data.AnswerWithProofs: God is the First and Chiefest Being.[1]

Data.Question: Ought every One to believe there is a God?
Data.Answer: Every One ought to believe there is a God; and it is their great Sin and Folly who do not.
Data.AnswerWithProofs: Every One ought to believe there is a God;[1] and it is their great Sin and Folly who do not.[2]

Data.Question: How may we know there is a God?
Data.Answer: The Light of Nature in Man, and the Works of God plainly declare there is a God; but his Word and Spirit only, do it fully and effectually, for the Salvation of Sinners.
Data.AnswerWithProofs: The Light of Nature in Man, and the Works of God plainly declare there is a God;[1] but his Word and Spirit only, do it fully and effectually, for the Salvation of Sinners.[2]

Data.Question: What is the Word of God?
Data.Answer: The Holy Scriptures of the Old and New Testaments are the Word of God, and the only certain Rule of Faith and Obedience.
Data.AnswerWithProofs: The Holy Scriptures of the Old and New Testaments are the Word of God, and the only certain Rule of Faith and Obedience.[1]

Data.Question: May all Men make use of the Holy Scriptures?
Data.Answer: All Men are not only permitted, but commanded and exhorted, to read, hear, and understand the Holy Scriptures.
Data.AnswerWithProofs: All Men are not only permitted, but commanded and exhorted, to read, hear, and understand the Holy Scriptures.[1]

Data.Question: What things are chiefly contained in the Holy Scriptures?
Data.Answer: The Holy Scriptures chiefly contain, what Man ought to believe concerning God, and what Duty God requireth of Man.
Data.AnswerWithProofs: The Holy Scriptures chiefly contain, what Man ought to believe concerning God, and what Duty God requireth of Man.[1]

Data.Question: What is God?
Data.Answer: God is a Spirit, Infinite, Eternal, and Unchangeable, in his Being, Wisdom, Power, Holiness, Justice, Goodness and Truth.
Data.AnswerWithProofs: God is a Spirit[1], Infinite[2], Eternal[3], and Unchangeable[4], in his Being[5], Wisdom[6], Power[7], Holiness[8], Justice, Goodness and Truth[9].

Data.Question: Are there more Gods than One?
Data.Answer: There is but One only, the Living and True God.
Data.AnswerWithProofs: There is but One only, the Living and True God[1].

Data.Question: How many Persons are there in the Godhead?
Data.Answer: There are Three Persons in the Godhead, the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit; and these Three are One God, the same in Essence, equal in Power and Glory.
Data.AnswerWithProofs: There are Three Persons in the Godhead, the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit; and these Three are One God, the same in Essence, equal in Power and Glory[1].

Data.Question: What are the Decrees of God?
Data.Answer: The Decress of God are, his Eternal Purpose according to the Counsel of his Will, whereby, for his own Glory, he hath foreordained whatsoever comes to pass.
Data.AnswerWithProofs: The Decress of God are, his Eternal Purpose according to the Counsel of his Will, whereby, for his own Glory, he hath foreordained whatsoever comes to pass[1].
